metadata.Title: CVE-2011-2695 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
Multiple off-by-one errors in the ext4 subsystem in the Linux kernel before 3.0-rc5 allow local users to cause a denial of service (BUG_ON and system crash) by accessing a sparse file in extent format with a write operation involving a block number corresponding to the largest possible 32-bit unsigned integer. It was discovered that the EXT4 filesystem contained multiple off-by-one flaws. A local attacker could exploit this to crash the system, leading to a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2011-2695` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
No subscription required

linux-image-3.4.0-1-flo - 3.4.0-1.3
No subscription required

linux-image-3.4.0-1-goldfish - 3.4.0-1.7
No subscription required

linux-image-3.1.10-8-grouper - 3.1.10-8.28
No subscription required

linux-image-3.0.0-3-maguro - 3.0.0-3.18
No subscription required

linux-image-3.4.0-3-mako - 3.4.0-3.21
No subscription required

linux-image-3.4.0-4-manta - 3.4.0-4.19
No subscription required

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
